intro: Sisyrinchium junceum subsp. depauperatum, commonly known as the slender blue-eyed grass, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are typically clustered in loose inflorescences, and it is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
